title: 107_s2231
content:
The Act titled "Survivors' and Dependents' Educational Assistance Adjustment Act of 2002" increases rates of educational assistance for survivors and dependents. The Act "Survivors' and Dependents' Educational Assistance Adjustment Act of 2002" amends Section 3532 of title 38, United States Code to increase educational assistance rates for survivors and dependents. The monthly rates are adjusted for full-time, three-quarter-time, and half-time pursuit for fiscal year 2003 and subsequent years. The Act "Survivors' and Dependents' Educational Assistance Adjustment Act of 2002" increases educational assistance rates for survivors and dependents. The rates for full-time, three-quarter-time, and half-time pursuit are adjusted for fiscal year 2003 and subsequent years. Nonveterans enrolled in the same program are required to pay $900 per month for a full-time course in fiscal year 2003, and $985 per month in subsequent years. The paragraph specifies adjustments to educational assistance rates for survivors and dependents under the Act "Survivors' and Dependents' Educational Assistance Adjustment Act of 2002". The basic rate is increased to $900 per month for fiscal year 2003 and $985 per month for subsequent years. Additionally, amendments are made to educational assistance allowances for different pursuit levels and correspondence courses. The paragraph discusses adjustments to apprenticeship training rates under the Act, with varying monthly rates based on the fiscal year. The amendments made by this section regarding educational assistance allowances under chapter 35 and section 3687(b)(2) of title 38, United States Code, will take effect on October 1, 2003. No adjustments in monthly training allowances rates will be made for fiscal years 2003 and 2004. SEC. 3. MODIFICATION OF DURATION OF EDUCATIONAL ASSISTANCE.

Section 3511(a)(1) of title 38, United States Code, is amended to allow 36 months of educational assistance for new claimants after the enactment of the Survivors' and Dependents' Educational Assistance Adjustment Act of 2002.

SEC. 4. INCREASE IN AGGREGATE ANNUAL AMOUNT AVAILABLE FOR STATE APPROVING AGENCIES FOR ADMINISTRATIVE EXPENSES.

Section 3674(a)(4) of title 38, United States Code, is amended to increase the annual amount available for administrative expenses to $18,000,000, effective October 1, 2002.
